lines.text: No ex-husband of Gloria's ever has to apologize to me about anything. We're like a little club.
I have done many terrible things in my life but I have never put another man's wife in my bed.
Wasn't she married to that Spanish painter when you slept with her?
Don't prove me wrong, Larry, I hate it when I'm proven wrong.

[from trailer]
I had a lousy day today. I turned 42, I fired a director, I beat my kids...
[his children look up, clearly alarmed]
I forgot to beat my kids!
[a family pillowfight ensues in the living room]
Eat it. It's healthy. You'll live longer.
I have a miserable life. I don't want to live longer.

[finding Alice at a table with three champagne flutes; a single aspirin is in front of each]
Why all the champagne?
I need it to take the aspirin.
Why do you need aspirin?
Oh, champagne gives me a headache.
You shove, shoot it, snort it. I gotta sell it.
Look, my kid's in the business.
Ivan, I'm not leaving you for another man.
Larry Kotzwinkle's not a man, he's a duck.

[helping her on with her fur coat]
What a fabulous look! What's it called?
Peach Divine.
Is it edible?
Do you think he's bi-sexual?
He never looked at a woman in his life!
I'm never gonna get married. Not ever. Even if you paid me a hundred and fifty dollars.
Larry is a wonderful man.
I'm thrilled to hear this.
Larry is a wonderful man, but he's not you.
That's what I figured when he scratched his leg and I felt nothing. 'This man is not me.'

[Snobs]
How can you joke at a time like this?
I joke, You snob. What difference does it make? We're both miserable.
Larry and I are moving to the Good Harbor Beach Inn in Massachusetts. We've agreed to live there for a three month trial period and if it works, we'll be married on Larry's birthday in March.
Okay... okay-I guess I'll be heading back to rehearsal. Enough taking time off from work for fun, huh? You can keep the night table, Gloria.
No...
I just wanna say that you are the craziest person I've met since the guy blocking the bank door. He was wearing a Superman cape and pantyhose... crazier than you... maybe not.
Okay, Gloria!
[picking up a table]
Sit down or I'm gonna hit you with this chair!
That's a table.
Oh good my cheesy I love my cheesy!
Bonnie, act your age.
I'm eleven.
Act it.
How the hell do you act eleven?
That's better.
Oh, Ivan. I'm hurting you.
That's the kindest thing you've said to me in six months, "Oh, Ivan, I'm hurting you."
GLORIA! GLOOOORIAAAAA!
Class dismissed!
You're at the goddamn typewriter 14 hours a day...
I'M AT THE GODDAMN TYPEWRITER, GLORIA... BECAUSE I'M A GODDAMN WRITER, GLORIA!
